title: PEPPER: Introduction to R
text:
This site contains short, practical tutorials to help PEPPER group members build skills in R using RStudio and tidyverse packages in [tidyverse-style code](https://style.tidyverse.org/. Here is a useful guide to installing R and RStudio.
Working through the tutorials here may be useful for those new to R, particually in preparation for working through the R for Health Technology Assessment text book if the contents of Chapter 2: Introduction to R is new.
Start with the first chapter or browse all tutorials from the sidebar.

title: 2  R and Quarto: quick start
text:
This tutorial confirms your setup and shows how to run code chunks.

# Base pipe with tidyverse conventions
library(tidyverse)

tib <- tibble(x = 1:5, y = x^2)
tib |>
  summarise(mean_x = mean(x), mean_y = mean(y))

# A tibble: 1 × 2
  mean_x mean_y
   <dbl>  <dbl>
1      3     11

title: 3  Data manipulation with dplyr
text:
We will create a small data frame and compute grouped summaries.

library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)

df <- tibble(
  id = 1:8,
  group = c("A","A","B","B","B","A","C","C"),
  value = c(3, 5, 2, 9, 4, 6, 1, 7)
) |>
  clean_names()

summary_tbl <- df |>
  group_by(group) |>
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    mean_value = mean(value),
    sd_value = sd(value),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) |>
  arrange(desc(mean_value))

summary_tbl

# A tibble: 3 × 4
  group     n mean_value sd_value
  <chr> <int>      <dbl>    <dbl>
1 B         3       5        3.61
2 A         3       4.67     1.53
3 C         2       4        4.24

title: 4  Visualisation with ggplot2
text:
We will plot the grouped means from the previous tutorial.

library(tidyverse)

summary_tbl <- tibble(
  group = c("A","B","C"),
  mean_value = c(4.67, 5.00, 4.00)
)

summary_tbl |>
  ggplot(aes(x = group, y = mean_value)) +
  geom_col() +
  geom_text(aes(label = round(mean_value, 2)), vjust = -0.4) +
  labs(
    x = "Group",
    y = "Mean value",
    title = "Mean by group"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

title: 5  Linear models: a minimal example
text:
Fit and interpret a simple linear model.

library(tidyverse)
set.seed(1)

dat <- tibble(
  x = seq(0, 10, length.out = 50),
  y = 2 + 0.8 * x + rnorm(50, sd = 1.5)
)

fit <- lm(y ~ x, data = dat)
broom::tidy(fit)

# A tibble: 2 × 5
  term        estimate std.error statistic  p.value
  <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
1 (Intercept)    2.17     0.351       6.19 1.28e- 7
2 x              0.795    0.0605     13.1  1.59e-17



# Visual check
library(ggplot2)

dat |>
  ggplot(aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE) +
  labs(title = "Linear fit", x = "x", y = "y") +
  theme_minimal()

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'










# Model summary and basic diagnostics
broom::glance(fit)
